item.title: AirAsia and AirAsia X introduce an innovative inflight menu concept
item.description:
Source: AirAsia. AirAsia and AirAsia X have introduced “Santan,” a new in-flight menu, replacing “AirAsia Café.” This change aims to elevate the airline group’s image and provide travelers with a more sophisticated culinary experience. Passengers can now purchase or pre-order new menu items, including nasi dagang and chicken curry, a Malaysian dish from the East Coast. Additional on-board purchases on AirAsia flights include teriyaki chicken rice cake and smoked chicken pizza sandwiches...

item.title: AquaMarine in Singapore offers a selection of nutritious buffet options
item.description:
Source: Marina Mandarin by Meritus. This April, AquaMarine, the restaurant located in Singapore’s luxurious 5-star Marina Mandarin hotel, is putting a spotlight on healthy dining. Their halal-certified buffet features a variety of fresh, organic ingredients. Through the end of April, AquaMarine diners can enjoy live cooking stations, fresh seafood, Singaporean favorites, and international dishes, all prepared with a healthy approach. For instance, the popular chicken rice at the Chinese live station is served with brown rice, and wholewheat flour is used for pasta and tortillas...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/aquamarine-in-singapore-offers-a-selection-of-nutritious-buffet-options/

item.title: Coral Al Khobar will be featuring a selection of dishes from the GCC, Levant, and Maghreb regions for iftar
item.description:
The Coral Al Khobar Hotel, centrally located in the city, is a perfect venue for enjoying an iftar buffet with loved ones. A diverse menu of Arabic and Mediterranean delicacies will be offered for the suhoor buffet, served from midnight to 3 am. The buffet will showcase a wide array of hot and cold dishes representing the cuisines of the GCC, Levant, and Maghreb regions. Michel Mandrea, the General Manager of Coral Al Khobar Hotel, highlighted the culinary team’s efforts, stating, “Our chefs have meticulously crafted the iftar and suhoor buffet menus to cater to every palate, including popular desserts traditionally enjoyed during Ramadan...

item.title: Experience the delightful combination of fragrance and culinary delights at Café Wolseley Bangkok and Jo Malone London
item.description:
Café Wolseley Bangkok and Jo Malone London have partnered to create a luxurious British experience, blending Café Wolseley’s culinary talents with Jo Malone London’s signature scents. Source: Café Wolseley Bangkok. Café Wolseley Bangkok’s Through the Grapevine menu is inspired by the aromatic notes of Jo Malone’s Cypress & Grapevine Cologne Intense. This collaboration celebrates the launch of Jo Malone London’s Cypress & Grapevine Cologne Intense. Available from July 1st to August 31st, guests can experience the Through the Grapevine lunch menu at Café Wolseley Bangkok...

item.title: Celebrate National Day with Amara Sanctuary Singapore's special promotion!
item.description:
Source: Amara Sanctuary Resort Sentosa. Singapore laksa. To commemorate Singapore’s 53rd birthday, the 5-star Amara Sanctuary Resort Sentosa is offering a National Day special at their Shutters restaurant. During this National Day celebration, Shutters’ dinner guests will enjoy a discounted Singapura buffet, priced at S$53++ per adult, down from the usual S$75++. This offer is valid from 6:30 pm to 10:00 pm. The buffet features local favorites like Nyonya laksa, barbequed stingray, and charcoal-grilled satay...

item.title: Grand Millennium Hotel Dubai introduces special Eid packages
item.description:
The Grand Millennium Hotel Dubai has revealed its plans for a lavish Eid celebration, including a grand feast and special offers throughout the holiday. The Atrium restaurant will host an Eid Lunch Buffet, priced at AED150 per person. Guests can enjoy signature dishes representing various Arab regions, live cooking stations, and international favorites. Peter Mansourian, General Manager of Grand Millennium Dubai, highlighted the restaurant’s reputation for exceptional cuisine, stating, “The Atrium enjoys the status of an exclusive restaurant for those willing to reward themselves with outstanding culinary fare as the outlet consistently delivers quality dishes in a familiar environment, with a team of dedicated staff to pamper and make you feel at home...

item.title: Sparkle under the moonlight during an afternoon tea in Hong Kong this September
item.description:
Source: The Langham, Hong Kong. The Twinkle in the Moonlight Afternoon Tea set. The Langham Hotel in Hong Kong is celebrating the Mid-Autumn Festival with a special afternoon tea inspired by Eastern flavors. Offered throughout September at the hotel’s Palm Court restaurant, the menu, created by Executive Pastry Chef David Puig, features treats like “The Moon,” a lychee and raspberry mousse cake decorated with a galaxy glaze. This dessert also includes rose essence, Sacher sponge cake, and a golden crescent moon topping...

item.description:
Source: InterContinental Hong Kong. Steamed abalone, sea urchin shijimi dashi jelly, and cured mackerel sashimi with chrysanthemum dressing. NOBU InterContinental Hong Kong presents the fifth installment of its GOURMET TOUR OF JAPAN series – Harvest in Aomori – which runs from September 12th to October 22nd. Executive Chef Sean Mell and Executive Sushi Chef Arakai Kaazunari have crafted special lunch and dinner menus that showcase the fall bounty of Aomori Prefecture, a region in northern Japan’s Tōhoku region...

item.title: GwaKu offers tasty and budget-friendly dishes in the center of Kuala Lumpur
item.description:
Source: Gwaku’s Facebook page. This is their famous ayam percik. GwaKu, a restaurant situated in Q Sentral close to KL Sentral, offers a rotating menu that keeps nearby office workers surprised about their lunch options. For example, one week could feature ayam perchik, while the following week might offer lamb stews. Mike Ibrahim, the founder of GwaKu, emphasizes their commitment to using fresh, seasonal, and locally sourced ingredients. He explains, “By using in-season produce, we can ensure quality and freshness while also benefiting from lower prices...

item.title: Tips for conducting business meetings in Jakarta
item.description:
The World Islamic Economic Forum (WIEF), hosted by the WIEF Foundation, will take place in Jakarta, Indonesia from August 2nd to 4th this year. If you’re looking for halal dining options for business meetings during the forum, consider these suggestions: Anomali Coffee With locations throughout Jakarta and Bali, Anomali Coffee is a great choice for a business meeting. They offer high-quality coffee with a focus on flavor and aroma. Their baristas are highly skilled, and each location provides free Wi-Fi and air conditioning for guests...

item.title: KLGCC will be hosting a dinner buffet during the month of Ramadhan
item.description:
Last year’s Ramadan dinner buffet at the Kuala Lumpur Golf and Country Club (KLGCC) was very successful. The culinary team is bringing it back this year with a Selera Nostalgia theme. The Selera Nostalgia buffet will feature dishes from over 100 cuisines. It will be set up in an open-air, stall-style setting by the pool and will include live cooking and performances. Some menu highlights, prepared by approximately 60 chefs, include nasi Arab, tom yam nelayan, kambing panggang, various pizzas and pastas, and local favorites...

item.description:

item.title: Grand Hyatt Mumbai reveals its plans for New Year's Eve
item.description:
The Grand Hyatt Mumbai, a premier Hyatt International property and a central hotel for Mumbai, Pune, and Goa, is hosting multiple New Year’s Eve celebrations. Starting at 7 pm, guests can enjoy the Grand Courtyard Party. This event features dancing under the stars, drinks, and desserts for INR 3,500 plus taxes. At 7 pm, several dining options are available. Soma offers North West Frontier cuisine with vegetarian and non-vegetarian choices. Celini provides Italian cuisine, while China House serves a Chinese-themed dinner...

item.description:
Capella Singapore is celebrating the Year of the Rooster with special menus at their Cantonese restaurant, Cassia, from January 28th, 2017. item.title: Simply smile to make your payment at this KFC restaurant in China
item.description:
A new, digitally connected experience for professionals living in urban areas. For the first time in the world, consumers can pay using facial recognition technology. Yum China Holdings, which owns KFC, has launched a new restaurant concept, KPRO by KFC, in Hangzhou, China – the same city where Alibaba is headquartered. item.description:

Peter Freeman, the Deputy Director General of the Armed Forces Officers Club & Hotel, highlighted that the hotel’s leading chefs will once again prepare a grand Iftar buffet. item.title: FUMI creates authentic Japanese dining experiences for customers
item.description:
Source: FUMI Facebook page. FUMI sushi. FUMI, a new Japanese eatery, seeks to share the finest Japanese cuisine in Hong Kong within a space adorned with Japanese art, furnishings, and tableware. They offer a range of dining experiences, from elaborate omakase and kaiseki dinners to individual dishes and set lunch options. Situated in California Tower, FUMI sources the highest quality seasonal ingredients directly from Japan daily. Flown in and delivered straight to their kitchen, these ingredients are often prepared and served within hours of being harvested, guaranteeing freshness in their sushi, sashimi, omakase, and kaiseki preparations, as well as a variety of seasonal menus...

item.description:

Starting at sunset, Dunes Café will serve a selection of traditional Arabic dishes from across the region, along with special beverages and an assortment of desserts. item.title: La Yeon is now offering its Spring Menu
item.description:
Source: The Shilla Seoul. La Yeon’s chilled pen shell salad with yuzu garlic sauce. La Yeon, the three-Michelin-starred Korean restaurant at The Shilla Seoul, renowned for its place on Asia’s 50 Best Restaurants list for three years running, introduces its new Spring Menu. This menu highlights the season’s freshest ingredients sourced directly from the Korean peninsula, reflecting La Yeon’s dedication to celebrating Korea’s rich culinary traditions. item.title: Experience the Peranakan Food Festival at Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy
item.description:
The Peranakan* Food Festival is making a comeback at the Grand Mercure Singapore Roxy! The hotel is bringing back this popular food festival with new additions to the menu, such as ayam masak rebung lemak (chicken with bamboo shoots in spicy gravy). Returning favorites include bubur cha cha (tapioca in coconut milk) and much more. Guests can explore booths showcasing Peranakan heritage at the Feast@East Buffet Restaurant. From June 10th to 19th, enjoy a variety of seafood at Feast@East Buffet Restaurant, featuring Chilean blue mussels, spanner crabs, and other crustacean favorites...

item.title: Experience a Festive Showcase of Cultural Treasures at Min Jiang at One-North
item.description:
Min Jiang at One-North is the only Chinese eatery located within a 3,000-square-foot, two-story colonial bungalow. From July 1 to August 31, 2017, Min Jiang at One-North (岷江在纬壹), a Singaporean restaurant specializing in modern Sichuan and Cantonese cuisine, will host “A Celebration of Heritage Delights (欢庆怀念佳肴).” This event offers patrons a chance to enjoy classic dishes popular in Singapore during the 1960s, 70s, and 80s. Since 2006, Master Chef Goh Chee Kong (吴志光) has captivated diners with his exquisitely plated dishes...

item.description:
Indulge in Peranakan sweets with the “Pay 1 Dine 2 Afternoon High Tea” at Hari’s Bar Lobby & Lounge.
Source: Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre. Pink kuih lapis is on the menu at the “Nyonya Delights Pay 1 Dine 2 High Tea.”

item.description:
Firebird Diner offers business breakfast and lunch options every weekday. The Business Breakfast includes a small smoked salmon bagel served with cream cheese and pickled onions, a fresh market greens salad, seasonal fruit, a Greek yogurt parfait with berries, and granola made in-house. item.description:
Originally from the Marina Mandarin Singapore website, this photo displays the Bakar Station’s offerings of chicken, oxtail, prawns, and sea bass cooked in banana leaves. AquaMarine, a Halal-certified buffet restaurant, has recently renovated its Terrace@AquaMarine space. Now fully air-conditioned, it’s an ideal location for larger gatherings. item.title: Experience an international Iftar at StraitsKitchen
item.description:
Source: Grand Hyatt Singapore website. For the observance of Ramadan, StraitsKitchen at the Grand Hyatt Singapore welcomes guests to experience a wide array of Asian flavors. Their iftar buffet features dishes from various countries, including Indonesia, India, Lebanon, Saudi Arabia, and Turkey, alongside Singaporean favorites. All food is freshly made in halal-certified kitchens. Guests can expect Middle Eastern specialties such as roasted leg of lamb from Saudi Arabia, Lebanese grilled fish (samke harra), shawarma, Moroccan mezze, and classic desserts like baklava, basbousa, and kanafa bil cream...

item.description:
Goodwood Park Hotel is celebrating the arrival of spring and Lunar New Year with a variety of festive treats, including yu sheng platters and savory specials, with a focus on the pineapple, a symbol of fortune. Among the delicious takeaway options are the Duo of Prosperity Fish, featuring mango with pomelo and sago, and durian pudding. item.title: Exclusive Mie menus featured at Japan Food Town this December
item.description:
Japan Food Town is celebrating a “Mie Prefecture Fair” from December 1st to 7th, 2016, showcasing special menus from over 13 restaurants using ingredients from Mie Prefecture, such as Matsusaka wagyu beef, Ise-ebi lobster, and fresh oysters. During this limited-time event, visitors can enjoy dishes made with top-grade A4 Matsusaka beef. This highly prized beef, exclusive to Japan Food Town in Singapore, comes from Special Grade Matsusaka Cattle raised in Mie Prefecture under the strict standards of the Matsusaka Cattle Council...

item.title: The Bazaar Desa buffet at Novotel KL City Centre is a celebration of street food
item.description:
This Ramadan, enjoy the Bazaar Desa buffet at the Square restaurant in Novotel KL City Centre, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. The buffet is available from June 20th to July 15th and will feature three rotating menus. Pictured above: grilled squid, the noodle station, an assortment of regional fruits, drinks such as khatirah, peach tea, bandung coconut, sugarcane juice, and sweetcorn juice, and marinated chicken perchik on shawarma. Executive Chef Huzaidy and their team have designed the Bazaar Desa buffet to showcase the diverse street food culture found throughout Malaysia during Ramadan...

item.title: Celebrate the year of the dog in a stylish manner at Pan Pacific Singapore
item.description:
Starting January 22, 2018, ring in the Year of the Earth Dog and usher in new beginnings at the Pan Pacific Singapore. Hai Tien Lo Executive Chef Lai Tong Ping of Hai Tien Lo (海天楼) has crafted eight special reunion set menus, including a vegetarian option, to commemorate this Chinese New Year.
